channel.title: Egoist in tragedy
channel.description:
Three lectures by David Grene, poet, translator, and Professor in the Committee on Social Thought, University of Chicago. He discusses a particular kind of tragedy and focuses on three examples.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Shakespeare: Coriolanus, part two
item.description: This program features the second part of David Grene's lecture on Shakespeare's Coriolanus.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616. Coriolanus.

item.title: The Philoctetes of Sophocles, part two
item.description: This program features the second part of David Grene's lecture on Sophocles' Philoctetes.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Sophocles. Philoctetes.

item.title: Ibsen's The Master-Builder, part two
item.description: This program features the conclusion of David Grene's lecture on Henrik Ibsen's The Master-Builder.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Ibsen, Henrik, 1828-1906--Criticism and interpretation.

item.title: Ibsen's The Master-Builder, part one
item.description: This program features the first part of David Grene's lecture on Henrik Ibsen's The Master-Builder.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Ibsen, Henrik, 1828-1906--Criticism and interpretation.

item.title: The Philoctetes of Sophocles, part one
item.description: This program features the first part of David Grene's lecture on Sophocles' Philoctetes.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Sophocles. Philoctetes.

item.title: Shakespeare: Coriolanus, part one
item.description: This program features the first part of David Grene's lecture on Shakespeare's Coriolanus.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616. Coriolanus.
